text: Yes but we want to avoid that additional click
Can CRM Cards not access DOM elements and Cookie / localStorage?
Nope, CRM Cards run in Sandboxed Iframes. There is no access the the dom and some hooks won't work!

Here's the pertinent link incase someone else also comes along and need more info. :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/ui-extensions/overview#accessing-dom-elements>
<@U04N6N424MB> what’s the end result you’re aiming for? There may be multiple ways to solve this.
trying to store a version of the global state for access after a refresh

For the past few hours, I have been struggling to validate the `X-HubSpot-Signature-v3` when running my project locally using `CLIENT_SECRET="ABC123" hs project dev`

I am using PHP and, specifically, Laravel to handle the requests. I have seen a few other threads online about this but I haven’t been able to solve the issues. I am using the HubSpot PHP SDK to validate <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php/blob/master/lib/Utils/Signature.php|the signatures>, and I have been referring to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/authentication/validating-requests#validate-the-v3-request-signature|documentation here>. My code is almost identical to what has been posted in this GitHub issue: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php/issues/226>

The documentation doesn’t state what the URI is included in the signature sent from HubSpot, as the requests are proxied from the intended URL to my local environment by using `local.json`

Example of the proxied request:
```Request to <https://api.example.com/HubSpot?userEmail=richard%40wearedomo.com&userId=67188843&portalId=145437528&appId=4707988>
[INFO] Mapping <https://api.example.com/HubSpot?userEmail=richard%40wearedomo.com&userId=67188843&portalId=145437528&appId=4707988> -> <http://api.example.test/HubSpot?userEmail=richard%40wearedomo.com&userId=67188843&portalId=145437528&appId=4707988>```
I have exhausted all possibilities, has anyone else encountered something similar when trying to validate signatures locally?

I am trying to pull images uploaded to a Custom Object "File" property and display them in a middle panel card. Is this possible?
The docs show that you need to import the image or use a url.
When I reference the image it just returns the ID. Is it possible to access the src?
